result.execSummary:
The defendant Erin K. Bukaty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with Andres Godina.   No alcohol.    No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------------

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin K. Bukaty

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Erin K. Bukaty in court with attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Erin Bukaty present in court, in custody with attorney Christopher Kuehn. Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mootion to modify bond by attorney Keuhn granted. Minutes filed.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANDRES GODINA.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Erin Bukaty present in court, in custody with attorney Christopher Kuehn. Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mootion to modify bond by attorney Keuhn granted. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.G.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney Julia May for bond purposes only. Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
